This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"send(uint64,address,bytes,bytes,bool)":{"params":{"_destinationChainRecipient":"The address of the CCIP recipient on the destination chain.","_destinationChainSelector":"The selector of the destination chain.","_distributionData":"The encoded arrays of recipients and amounts.","_extraArgs":"The encoded extra arguments for the message.","_payFeesInLink":"Whether the fees will be paid in LINK tokens."}},"setExtraArgs(uint64,uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the owner.","params":{"_destinationChainSelector":"The selector of the destination chain.","_gasLimit":"The gas limit to execute on a destination chain."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Should indicate whether the contract implements IAny2EVMMessageReceiver e.g. return interfaceId == type(IAny2EVMMessageReceiver).interfaceId || interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId This allows CCIP to check if ccipReceive is available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. Additionally, if the receiver address does not have code associated with it at the time of execution (EXTCODESIZE returns 0), only tokens will be transferred.","params":{"interfaceId":"The interfaceId to check"},"returns":{"_0":"true if the interfaceId is supported"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). allowlistRecipient(uint64,address,bool).details: This function can only be called by the owner.

params._destinationChainRecipient: The address of the CCIP recipient to be updated.
params._destinationChainSelector: The selector of the destination chain.
params.allowed: The allowlist status to be set for the pair of recipient and destination chain.

allowlistSender(uint64,address,bool).details: This function can only be called by the owner.

params._sourceChainSelector: The selector of a source chain.
params._sourceChainSender: The address of the CCIP sender to be updated.
params.allowed: The allowlist status to be set for the pair of sender and source chain.

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.details: Note ensure you check the msg.sender is the OffRampRouter

params._destinationChainRecipient: The address of the CCIP recipient on the destination chain.
params._destinationChainSelector: The selector of the destination chain.
params._extraArgs: The encoded extra arguments for the message.
params._payFeesInLink: Whether the fees will be paid in LINK tokens.

params._link: The address of the LINK Token.
params._rare: The address of the RARE Token.
params._router: The address of the CCIP Router.
params.admin: The address of the RARE bridge administrator account.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._destinationChainRecipient: The address of the CCIP recipient on the destination chain.
params._destinationChainSelector: The selector of the destination chain.
params._distributionData: The encoded arrays of recipients and amounts.
params._extraArgs: The encoded extra arguments for the message.
params._payFeesInLink: Whether the fees will be paid in LINK tokens.

setExtraArgs(uint64,uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner.

params._destinationChainSelector: The selector of the destination chain.
params._gasLimit: The gas limit to execute on a destination chain.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Should indicate whether the contract implements IAny2EVMMessageReceiver e.g. return interfaceId == type(IAny2EVMMessageReceiver).interfaceId || interfaceId == type(IERC165).interfaceId This allows CCIP to check if ccipReceive is available before calling it. If this returns false or reverts, only tokens are transferred to the receiver. If this returns true, tokens are transferred and ccipReceive is called atomically. Additionally, if the receiver address does not have code associated with it at the time of execution (EXTCODESIZE returns 0), only tokens will be transferred.

returns._0: true if the interfaceId is supported

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdraw(address).details: This function reverts if there are no funds to withdraw or if the transfer fails.

params._beneficiary: The address to which the Ether should be sent.

allowlistRecipient(uint64,address,bool).notice: Updates the allowlist status of a destination chain for transactions.

allowlistSender(uint64,address,bool).notice: Updates the allowlist status of a sender for transactions.

ccipReceive((bytes32,uint64,bytes,bytes,.notice: Called by the Router to deliver a message. If this reverts, any token transfers also revert. The message will move to a FAILED state and become available for manual execution.

getFee(uint64,address,bytes,bytes,bool).notice: Calculates the estimated fee for sending a message.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initializes the contract with the CCIP router, LINK, and RARE address.

send(uint64,address,bytes,bytes,bool).notice: Sends RARE tokens a destination chain.

setExtraArgs(uint64,uint256).notice: Set sendTokens() extra args per destination chain.

withdraw(address).notice: Allows the contract owner to withdraw the entire balance of Ether from the contract.
